message_1:
Suppose there are two doors in front of you, one that leads to a room with a treasure and one that leads to an empty room. You do not know which door leads to the treasure. You are allowed to ask a question to the guard stationed in front of the doors, who knows which door leads to the treasure. You can only ask a question to which the guard can respond with "yes" or "no". 

What is the minimum number of questions needed to determine which door leads to the treasure?
message_2: The minimum number of questions needed to determine which door leads to the treasure is 1. You can ask the guard, "If I were to ask you if the left door leads to the treasure, would you say 'yes'?" If the guard says "yes," then the left door leads to the treasure; if the guard says "no," then the right door leads to the treasure.
